channel.title: All Saints Day on Sermon Archives
channel.description: Recent content in All Saints Day on Sermon Archives

item.title: Blessed Are They
item.description: Here is a digital sermon that was found on a 3.5 inch floppy disk. It was converted from an ancient WordPerfect format to PDF.

item.title: A Host Arrayed in White
item.description: This is a handwritten sermon which appears to be from All Saints Day in 1972.

item.title: For All the Saints
item.description: This sermon is a typed All Saints Day sermon from 1976, with notes and highlights in red.

item.title: This Meal of Hope and Thanks
item.description: This is another example of a “same name, different sermon” sermon. It has the same name as the previous sermon from 1975, but this one is typed and from 1980. There are also notes in light blue ink.

item.title: This Meal of Hope and Thanks
item.description: Here is a handwritten sermon from 1975 for All Saints Day.

item.title: The Givers' Arena
item.description: This is an All Saints Day sermon from 1987. The sermon includes several references, including a very interesting story about a woman that I’ve never heard about before.

item.title: For All the Saints -- For You and Me Too!!
item.description: Here is a typed 1988 All Saints sermon, covering the gospel text from Matthew 5: 1-12.

item.title: When We Mourn
item.description: With All Saints Day coming up, I found a sermon from 1978 about mourning.

item.title: R.S.V.P.
item.description: This is an All Saints Day sermon from 1982. There is a reference to the French meaning of RSVP, but it’s apparent that he’s not a French scholar.

item.title: Remembering And Resembling
item.description: This sermon is from All Saints Day of 1994, and was preached at Carthage College. In addition to the sermon, a scanned copy of the bulletin is included. Marta is listed as the featured soloist in one of the songs.
